I believe there are still<br>some free downloads of it available via the link, but it's on [...] bishop julia 2015-02-04T09:53:26+00:00 2015-02-04T09:53:26+00:00 Special issue of IJP now published on the lives and legacy of Iona and Peter Opie https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILDLORE;6226b6d7.1502 **Please note that if you press the Reply button to respond to this mailing, it will be distributed to everyone on the Childlore List. If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We am delighted to inform you that a special issue of the *International<br>Journal of Play* entitled 'Lifework and Legacy: Reviewing Iona and Peter<br>Opie's Contribution to the Study of Play' has just been published. Many<br>members of this list have contributed to the special issue and we<br>gratefully acknowledge the work of everyone involved. If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Hello All,<br><br>I've been looking at YouTube clips of Ghanaian children's play as part of<br>the Exploring Play MOOC that the University of Sheffield is running at the<br>moment (see my previous email if you're interested in signing up - it's not<br>too late!). And I came across this song, Sansa Kroma. If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>On 23 May 2015 the Sussex Centre for Folklore, Fairy Tales and Fantasy will<br>host a PGR Symposium entitled "Wonderlands: Reading/Writing/Telling Fairy<br>Tales and Fantasy." Timed to coincide with the 150th anniversary of *Alice\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds<br>Adventures in Wonderland*, this event is primarily aimed at postgraduate<br>students and early career researchers, although other scholars and the<br>general [...] bishop julia 2014-09-26T00:15:55+01:00 2014-09-26T00:15:55+01:00 Free course on Exploring Play starts next week! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILDLORE;db8c2cca.1409 **Please note that if you press the Reply button to respond to this mailing, it will be distributed to everyone on the Childlore List. The University of Pittsburgh Department of English is hiring in children's literature. The details are below. It is excellent to have<br>confirmation that the Davy Crockett phenomenon was alive and well in<br>Australia. Was this around the later 1950s? If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Hi Julia,<br>I watched Fess Parker as Davy Crockett on television as a child, and can<br>still sing the theme song (well, the first verse anyway). I grew up in<br>Ballarat, Australia, and remember how my brother and I frantically<br>collected icypole wrappers, so we could have enough to send away for a<br>'real' Davy Crockett coonskin [...] bishop julia 2014-07-04T09:20:50+01:00 2014-07-04T09:20:50+01:00 Re: information about Davy Crockett https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILDLORE;3292a0d2.1407 **Please note that if you press the Reply button to respond to this mailing, it will be distributed to everyone on the Childlore List. If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Thanks, John, for relaying this vivid account, and thanks to your wife for<br>her recollections! It's fascinating to hear about the home-made costume -<br>the hat sounds better than Davy Crockett's own! [...] John Turrell 2014-07-02T14:09:19+01:00 2014-07-02T14:09:19+01:00 Re: information about Davy Crockett https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILDLORE;6adee9e7.1407 **Please note that if you press the Reply button to respond to this mailing, it will be distributed to everyone on the Childlore List. If you want to make a personal reply, you will need to modify the Reply-To line of your message.**<br><br>Hello Julia,<br><br>Re Davy Crockett<br><br>My wife tells me that following the Davy Crockett film release she spent at<br>least two years of her early childhood immersed in the re-living of Davy<br>Crockett in rural Worcestershire. She wore a home made version (fashioned<br>from a redundant fox-fur complete with head) of the famous raccoon hat.
